1.text: Put the bib 4 inches (10 cm) - 5 inches (13 cm) below your collar bone.

2.text: Tie a knot in the back of the loop if the apron has a single bib loop.

3.text: Thread the tie through the loop if the apron has a tie/loop closure.

4.text: Cut the neck loop and tie a knot if you have a long single neck loop.

5.text: Bring your apron’s strings together in the back.

6.text: Tie them together using a knot or a bow.

7.text: Tug on your knot to test its strength.

8.text: Practice tying with your eyes closed to get faster.

9.text: Test to see if the apron falls above or below your knees.

10.text: Cross your apron’s ties behind you and bring them around to the front.

11.text: Tie your apron in a knot or a bow.

12.text: Test your knot for strength by pulling on it gently.
